‚úÖ What This Node Does:

It takes the cleaned submission data (from the Code node) and adds a new row to your Airtable base every time a lead submits your form.

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è Airtable Setup Steps

  1. Create Your Airtable Base  
‚Ä¢ Go to Airtable and create a new base (or use an existing one).  
‚Ä¢ Create a table named something like Leads or Client Inquiries.  
‚Ä¢ Add the following columns (fields) to your table:  
‚Ä¢ Name  
‚Ä¢ Email  
‚Ä¢ Business Name  
‚Ä¢ Project Intent/Need  
‚Ä¢ Timeline  
‚Ä¢ Budget



üîÅ You can rename or customize these fields ‚Äî just make sure the names match what you map in n8n.

‚∏ª

  1. Get Your Airtable API Credentials  
‚Ä¢ In Airtable, click your account icon ‚Üí Developer Hub  
‚Ä¢ Generate a Personal Access Token (with read/write permissions to the base you‚Äôre using)



‚∏ª

  1. Configure the Airtable Node in n8n 
     1. Add an Airtable node after your Code node.
     2. Choose the operation: Create Record.
     3. Connect your Airtable account using the Personal Access Token.
     4. Select:  
‚Ä¢ Base ID: Choose or paste your base  
‚Ä¢ Table Name: Select your target table (e.g. Leads)
     5. Map fields like this:  
‚Ä¢ Name ‚Üí {{$json["name"]}}  
‚Ä¢ Email ‚Üí {{$json["email"]}}  
‚Ä¢ Business Name ‚Üí {{$json["businessName"]}}  
‚Ä¢ Project Intent/Need ‚Üí {{$json["project intent/need"]}}  
‚Ä¢ Timeline ‚Üí {{$json["timeline"]}}  
‚Ä¢ Budget ‚Üí {{$json["budget"]}}



‚∏ª

üîÑ Test It  
1\. Submit your form with test data.  
2\. Check your Airtable table ‚Äî a new row should appear instantly.
